meanings.definition: Either side of the face below the eye.
meanings.sent1: She felt a tear roll down her cheek.
meanings.sent2: He planted a gentle kiss on her cheek.
meanings.sent3: The cheek of that squirrel stealing my nuts!
meanings.sent4: The sun kissed her cheek with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The child's rosy cheek glowed in the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: His cheek in questioning the teacher's authority was not appreciated.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't believe the cheek of the salesperson trying to overcharge her.
meanings.sent3: The cheek of that bird stealing crumbs from the picnic!
meanings.sent4: Her cheek in ignoring my advice will come back to haunt her.
meanings.sent5: The politician's cheek in making false promises was evident to all.

meanings.sent1: She blushed when the doctor asked her to turn and show him her cheek.
meanings.sent2: He felt a sharp pain in his cheek after sitting for too long.
meanings.sent3: The cheek of that chair to break under his weight!
meanings.sent4: Her cheek ached from the long hours of sitting.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's toned cheek muscles helped him run faster.
